explanation: The report is correct. lfs_mlist_isopen takes non-const struct lfs_mlist * parameters but only inspects the list and does not modify the pointed-to objects. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 requires that pointers should point to const-qualified types whenever possible. The current implementation (and the call which casts to (struct lfs_mlist*)file) therefore fails to qualify the parameters as const. Note that the function body currently uses a pointer-to-pointer idiom (struct lfs_mlist **p = &head) which is not directly compatible with changing the parameters to const without adjusting the loop. A simple, safe fix is to change the prototype to static bool lfs_mlist_isopen(const struct lfs_mlist *head, const struct lfs_mlist *node) and iterate with a const pointer (for (const struct lfs_mlist *p = head; p; p = p->next) ...) so no cast is needed at the call site. If the function actually needs to modify nodes or use pointer-to-pointer semantics elsewhere, then const cannot be applied; but given the shown implementation it can and should be const-qualified.
